alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 1:20PM PST until January 11 at 2:49AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .A storm system coming into western Washington today will bring 3 to 5 inches of rain through Tuesday for the Olympic Peninsula. The snow level will rise to near 6000 feet for the bulk of the heavy precipitation. This will drive the Skokomish River above flood stage tonight to a crest approaching Moderate Flood Stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PST Monday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - 10 - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 17.4 feet late tomorrow morning. It will fluctuate around 17.4 through Tuesday night before falling below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 03/06/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 1230 AM PST.
